Description: Fragment of thick, weft-faced, plain weave wool textile; Undyed/cream with two wide and two narrow purple-coloured bands; Purple yarn made up from fibres varying from blue to red; Narrow bands c.6mm deep, together are 1-4cm; Complete wider band is 9.5cm; Warp: S spu wooln, c.9tpc; Weft: S spun wool, c.40tpc; Edges: torn or cut.
Curator's comments: Found 1988? in packet in Keeper's Office; Previous location cupboard O; Very likely from a tunic, the wide bands paired clavus and the narrow bands accompanying the side seams; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (12.2.1991)
